Exaggerate: The claim may be seen as exaggerating the situation by stating that a coronavirus patient has been identified in the Purnea district of Bihar, when there is no evidence to support this claim.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no confirmation or evidence provided to support the existence of a novel coronavirus patient in the Purnea district.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes the existence of a coronavirus patient based on a misleading Facebook post, without verifying the information or providing any evidence.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the statements of experts, including Dr. Ragini Mishra and the Chief Medical Officers of Purnea and Bhagalpur, who confirmed that there are no confirmed coronavirus cases in the districts.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in this claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by relying on a misleading Facebook post and not verifying the information before making the claim.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no alternative explanation bias in this claim.
